definition: at worst/if worst comes to worst/serious/alarming
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
(negative prefix)/not/no
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly

sentences.english: It’s no big deal. I don’t mind helping you out.
sentences.chinese: 這沒什麼大不了的，我不介意幫助你擺脫困境。

sentences.english: But in our 13-year-old brains we thought it was nothing big deal.
sentences.chinese: 但是在我們這羣13歲孩子看來，這沒什麼大不了的。

sentences.english: Wiley doesn't see "any big deal" with the security measures.
sentences.chinese: Wiley覺得這些安保措施沒什麼大不了。

sentences.english: What are you being such a weenie for?So he has a Barbie. Big deal.
sentences.chinese: 你幹嘛這麼小家子氣他有個芭比，有什麼大不了？

sentences.english: In the last resort we can always swim back.
sentences.chinese: 大不了我們可以游回來。

sentences.english: Today's generators are not much bigger than a matchbox.
sentences.chinese: 今天這種發電器造得比火柴盒大不了多少。

sentences.english: It's no problem. But I can't remember all these names.
sentences.chinese: 這沒什麼大不了的，但我記不全所有這些名字。

sentences.english: At the hospital, nudity is no big deal.
sentences.chinese: 在醫院裏，裸露沒什麼大不了的。

sentences.english: It’s only a white lie, so it’s no big deal.
sentences.chinese: 這只是一個無惡意的小謊言，沒什麼大不了的。

sentences.english: Doctor after doctor told Baker his lump was not a big deal.
sentences.chinese: 多名醫生相繼通知貝克，塊狀物沒什麼大不了的。

sentences.english: It's no problem. I don't mind helping you out.
sentences.chinese: 這沒什麼大不了的，我不介意佐理你擺脫逆境。

sentences.english: Throw caution to the wind, in case of failure, we just start from scratch again.
sentences.chinese: 豁出去了，要真的失敗了，我們大不了從頭開始。

sentences.english: Empty wine bottle have a bad opinion of women.
sentences.chinese: 空酒瓶認爲女人沒甚大不了。

sentences.english: Big pharma will say it's no big deal but I disagree.
sentences.chinese: 大型製藥公司會說那沒什麼大不了，但我不同意。

sentences.english: Cutting up a one-dollar bill did not seem like such a big deal.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲把它剪成碎片，沒有甚麼大不了。

definition: to be indifferent/not to matter/cannot be said to be
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
it doesn't matter
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
let it be/let it pass/forget about it
at most/at best
anyway/in any case/to come over from the enemy's side
no harm (in doing it)/One might as well./It won't hurt./no matter/it's no bother
don’t worry about (it, him etc)/doesn’t matter/whatever/anyway
not worthwhile
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
granted that/even if
God knows.../Who would have imagined...?
(coll.) maybe/perhaps
